Job Description
Excited to grow your career? Do you have a passion for machine learning / artificial intelligence? Are you excited about using your skills to help individual's improve their health?

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.

Evernorth's Data Science Center of Expertise applies advanced Data Science (DS), Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to produce solutions that reduce customer health costs and improve outcomes and business processes. Using state of the art AI tools, DS platforms, ML libraries, and optimization tools, we leverage internal, external, online and offline data sources comprising clinical, provider & Rx data, and behavioral/attitudinal data.
Role Summary

Using your knowledge of ML / AI you will build technologies to determine when a customer might be at risk and what actions can be taken to help improve health trajectories. Your work will require deep acquaintance with Evernorth's data, seeking to find ways to deliver value through advanced feature engineering. From your models you will deliver actionable insights that can be incorporated into existing Evernorth wellness products as well as new programs. In addition to collaborating with Data Science Management to establish strategic priorities, you will work closely with Data & Engineering to deliver code that is robust and ready to scale.

The ideal candidate for this role will have strong coding skills (preferably in Python), a passion for creating technology to improve health care, and an attitude of creativity and continual learning.
This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.
Responsibilities
Create models using ML / AI techniques to predict risk and identify actionable insights
Deliver clean, reusable, and scalable code
Work closely with Data & Engineering to deploy models
Provide thought leadership on latest analytic techniques, technologies and methods
Qualifications
Bachelor's in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or in any technical field that provides a solid basis for analytics and/or equivalent work experience
At least 3 years' of experience with leading ML / AI methods; XGBoost, deep learning, reinforcement learning, optimization required
At least 3 years' of experience with Python and its data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy and Keras required
Excellent oral and written communication skills

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.
For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 95,800 - 159,600 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

job_title: Independent Testing Specialist - Customer Remediation Testing
job_description: About This Role
Wells Fargo is seeking an Independent Testing Specialist within the Independent Testing and Validation (IT&V) group as part of Corporate Risk.

The Independent Testing and Validation (IT&V) group is responsible for establishing and maintaining a consolidated Enterprise Testing program at the corporate level and for developing a common methodology and standards, providing governance and oversight, executing testing; and conducting horizontal reviews. Testing and validation teams are responsible for implementing the Enterprise Testing methodology, standards, and executing group- specific testing.

The Customer Remediation Testing team within IT&V is responsible for testing customer remediation activities executed by the Customer Remediation Center of Excellence (CR COE) and the Customer Remediation Verification team.

The Independent Testing Specialist is responsible for performing targeted testing activities that independently evaluates the effectives of key controls and validating IT&V identified issues relating to customer remediations. They are also responsible for completing timely and high-quality testing activities, as well as, for identifying issues, validation concerns and observations, recommending corrective actions, presenting results, interfacing with business and risk partners, and writing reports.
In This Role, You Will
Participate in moderate to high risk or complex review activities in a matrixed environment and communicate emerging risks to management within Independent Testing
Contribute to large scale planning related to Independent Testing deliverables
Review and research moderately complex potential corrective actions, and follow through on reporting, escalation, and resolution
Ensure effective and appropriate testing, validation, and documentation of review activities for risk programs and controls according to standards and other applicable policies
Resolve moderately complex issues and
Meet Independent Testing deliverables while leveraging solid understanding of risk management framework and the risk and control environment
Collaborate and consult with colleagues, internal partners, management, and lines of business regarding risk management
Required Qualifications, US:
2+ years of Independent Testing experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
Desired Qualifications:
Knowledge and understanding of financial services industry: compliance, risk management, or audit operations

Experience reviewing testing strategies and methodologies; evaluating the adequacy and effectiveness of policies, procedures, processes, initiatives, products, and internal controls; and identifying issues resulting from internal and/or external compliance examinations
Prior public accounting firm with experience in business process
Desired one of the following: Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM)
Experience providing challenge to business partners, when necessary, with the ability to lead through influence
Ability to evaluate the risk holistically and proactively through critical thinking and analytical skills
Intermediate Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)
Ability to take on a high level of responsibility, initiative, and accountability

Demonstrated negotiation skills, especially with difficult topics when partnering with lines of business and other key stakeholders. This includes the willingness and ability to question decisions, understand direction and escalate issues where necessary
Strong, clear and concise written and oral communication skill
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to interact with all levels of an organization

The Ford Motor Company Fund is the corporate foundation and philanthropic arm of the Ford Motor Company. For more than 70 years the Ford Fund has been supporting communities and has invested more than $2.1 billion in initiatives that ensure basic needs are met, provide access to essential services, offer tools to build new abilities and open pathways to high quality jobs.

The Fund’s work is rooted in Ford’s long-standing commitment to making a positive impact on society and builds on Ford’s legacy of helping create strong communities wherever Ford does business. Programming: Initiatives the Ford Fund has created, which are unique to the organization, and are replicated in multiple countries around the world.
Volunteerism: Through the Ford Volunteer Corps – a global network of Ford employees and retirees who volunteer their time for community service projects.
Grantmaking: Awarding grants to organizations and initiatives that support the Ford Fund’s key areas of focus: essential services, social justice, education, and workforce development.

This position is physically located in Albuquerque, NM with a hybrid schedule of 2 days on site, 3 days off site. This role will directly support US DoD customers and requires U.S citizenship to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance.
What do we do?

We are a team of software engineers, computational scientists, and DevOps engineers working collaboratively with RF applications and space physics subject matter experts from government and academia to develop next-generation RF propagation applications for US government customers. We are both individuals with innate problem-solving and a team with strong engineering discipline. We tackle tough physical science modeling and simulation and software engineering challenges while maintaining collegial work culture and promoting a work-balance lifestyle.
What will you do?
Help build enduring RF processing software assets to continuously deliver innovative RF impact products to DoD missions
Apply software ingenuity to creating key integration gateways between science code and computing infrastructure
Promote API-first approach and deliver robust software implementation
Mature computing infrastructure
Rescue/reverse-engineering troubled scientific code
Required Skills
Minimum of 10 years of experience developing C/C++, Python, and JavaScript-based applications
Must have knowledge and experience working in the Unix/Linux development environment, command line, and shell scripting, in developing numerical computational analytical software.
Must have the knowledge of real-time processing systems and concepts related to the operating system, kernel, user space, and concurrency (BSD sockets)
Expertise in make-based build tool and git for large-scale and distributed software development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
US citizenship, due to the nature of the work and contract requirement
Desired
Active DoD Secret clearance
Masters’ or Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, or another relevant field
Experience or background in space weather science or ionosphere physics and RF communication and radar is highly desirable.
Experience architecting Kubernetes solutions and other foundational AWSGovCloud technology is desired
Familiarity with Fortran programming and experience using HPC such as OpenMP or GPU programming using CUDA framework.
Education
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, and related discipline, or equivalent. Master's degree and PhD are preferred.

About Our Client

We are the global leader in e-commerce technology, helping companies seize the full potential of every transaction moment to grow revenue and acquire new customers at scale. About The Role

We are looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist to lead our Marketplace efforts. We operate a robust marketplace connecting customers to relevant products and services across the world’s biggest e-commerce players, serving 1B transactions a year and growing 51% YoY. We’re constantly looking to develop this marketplace, especially as we expand into new verticals and markets, and we’re constantly innovating on the auction mechanics to ensure the best outcomes for our customers, advertisers, and partners. We’re looking for an entrepreneurial leader with the stats, econometrics, and modeling chops to own the health of this marketplace and lead our strategy for growing this.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for owning the health of our marketplace and driving its growth, including:
Defining the metrics for tracking the health of our marketplace, and build tracking to monitor this
Proactive analysis and modeling to identify opportunities to further develop the marketplace, including innovating and building cutting-edge auction mechanics / pricing
Partnering closely with R&D and Sales stakeholders to develop the strategy for growing the marketplace, including the product roadmap and Sales programs to drive growth
Conducting deep dives on marketplace impact to support high impact launches and Sales growth
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Math, or related fields.
Strong academic or professional experience with the latest auction theory
Entrepreneurial ownership and a deep desire to push the status quo
Strong and clear communication skills
Experience working with scaled marketplace and auction-driven businesses
Strong analytical / modeling experience tied to business outcomes
Good knowledge of Python 3 and SQL
Applied use of visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, tableau
Experience with common Python data science libraries such as pandas, numpy and scipy
Experience with relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL and/or SQL Server

About This Position

The Department of Public Health Sciences at the University of Miami, Miller School of Medicine has an exciting opportunity for a full time Data Scientist. This position is for a social network analyst to work under the direction of Dr. Mariano Kanamori from the Department of Public Health Sciences at the University of Miami. The analyst will be responsible for analyses, interpretations, reports, and publications.
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, operational efficiencies, and other business outcomes.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Adheres to University and unit-level policies and procedures and safeguards University assets.
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.
Minimum Qualifications
Master's Degree in a closely related field of study

Three years of relevant experience in SNA research design, implementation, and analyses; preferably in a public health/health setting; in SNA visualization tools (e.g., Cytoscape, Gephi, UCINET, and R); in data manipulation, cleaning, and running bivariate and multivariate analyses using R/SPSS; and in translating findings into manuscripts, conference presentations, and/or reports
Ability to maintain effective interpersonal relationships
Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form
Skill in collecting, organizing and analyzing data
Proficiency in computer software (i.e. Microsoft Office)
Ability to work independently and/or in a collaborative environment
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of social network analysis (SNA) research methods
Working knowledge of descriptive and inferential SNA analyses (e.g., network structures, centrality, centralization, hypothesis testing, dyadic and network level tests)
Working knowledge of SNA models
Quadratic Assignment Procedure (QAP)
Multiple Regression Quadratic Assignment Procedure (MRQAP)
Linear Network Autocorrelation Models (LNAM)
Mixed-Effects Models/Multilevel Models (MLM)
Working knowledge of both sociocentric and egocentric analyses
Willingness to learn or experience in the design and testing of questionnaires for SNA in REDCap, Qualtrics, and/or Network Canvas
Any relevant education, certifications and/or work experience may be considered.

Consultants conduct extensive research, data collection and evaluation and analysis in order to make recommendations to control customer's source of risk, loss and/or costs.
Please Note: This position is eligible to be hired at differed levels depending on experience.
Responsibilities
Construction area of expertise preferred.

Risk Selection: Partnering with UW & Distribution to adequately provide an opinion of risk to meet profitability objectives through pre-bind and renewal risk assessments. Develop strategies and influence stakeholder to reduce total cost of risk.

Account Service: Work with customer stakeholders to provide comprehensive risk control services and assists in meeting customer key performance indicators. Including a deep understanding of customer operations and the industry exposures in order to develop strategies to mitigate risk.

Leadership: Having the ability to cross collaborate, innovate, influence and inspire those around them to meet a common goal. This includes mentoring and coaching, owning personal and career growth aspirations.
Continuous Improvement: Having a growth mindset that allows for continuous improvement of work product, service delivery, in a collaborative way that provides consistent innovation.
Relationship Building: Ability to form and sustain relationships at all levels of customer organization and become a trusted influencer in order to impact business objectives.
Key Capabilities And Characteristics
Inquisitive thinking and problem-solving skills. Can leverage these skills to influence change.
Able to adapt to changing and competing priorities demonstrating resilience and flexibility.
Demonstrates personal energy, stamina and discretionary effort.
Works with a sense of urgency and handles setbacks/feedback with a growth mindset.
Strong collaboration skills and commitment to continuous improvement.
Ability to develop and maintain relationships with customers, peers, and industry contacts.
Capacity to become trusted advisor and partner with the customer.
Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
Strong communication and listening skills in order to develop and maintain relationships with customers.
Proven ability in advance level research, evaluation and analysis functions.
Proven ability to deal with all levels of an organization.
Effective leadership qualities.
Maintains advanced level of understanding loss prevention products, services and operations within realm of responsibility.
Successful demonstration of technical skills in areas of risk assessment, risk analysis, solutions management and progress measurement.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent with coursework in mathematics and engineering or related area, plus a minimum of 3 years of directly related consulting experience.
Previous experience applicable to loss prevention may be substituted for lack of formal education or advanced degree may be substituted for 2 years of experience.
Master’s degree, designation(s) or certification(s) preferred.

Title: Data Scientist
Location: Vacaville, CA/Hybrid
Description
Job Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Responsible for executing data engineering/analysis tasks, and writing reports to support data analysis solutions or model validation
Responsible for coordinating technical meetings and supporting process experts to translate a problem from the process/equipment domain into data engineering or analysis domain
Identifies opportunities for data science to overcome technology challenges
Skills
Some knowledge of statistical process control and data analysis techniques
Have experience working with equipment in the laboratory, pilot plant, or manufacturing settings
General knowledge of the underlying scientific principles applied to the development and manufacture of biopharmaceuticals.
Some understanding of the following software: R and/or Python
Understanding machine learning or experience in first principal modeling is a plus
Education
BS or higher degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Sciences, Statistics
Desire to have more than one-year work experience in the biopharmaceutical industry
About Our Client

We are the global leader in e-commerce technology, helping companies seize the full potential of every transaction moment to grow revenue and acquire new customers at scale. Live Nation, Groupon, Staples, Lands’ End, Fanatics, UrbanStems, GoDaddy, Vistaprint and HelloFresh are among the more than 2,500 leading global businesses and advertisers that are using our solutions to drive more value through every transaction by offering highly relevant messages to their customers at the moment they are most likely to convert.

With our December 2021 Series E raise of USD$325M, we're is expanding rapidly and globally – operating in 19 countries across North America, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region with the largest office in NYC and a major R&D hub in Sydney. With annual revenues of more than US$200M and vibrant company culture, we have been listed in ‘Great Places to Work’ in the US and Australia. Our award-winning culture is guided by our five core values: Smart with Humility, Own the Outcomes, Force for Good, Conquer New Frontiers, and Enjoy the Ride. These values help us attract, engage, and develop the right talent around the globe and ensure we have the right conditions to do our best work. Keen to join a fast-growing company and a vibrant culture?

Our engineering team builds best-in-class e-commerce technology that provides personalized and relevant experiences for customers globally and empowers marketers with sophisticated, AI-driven tooling to better understand consumers. Our bespoke platform handles millions of transactions per day and considers billions of data points which give engineers the opportunity to build technology at scale, collaborate across teams and gain exposure to a wide range of technology. We are expanding rapidly in our major R&D centers in NYC and Sydney. We are passionate about using intelligent systems to improve the transaction moment for retailers everywhere. Come join us and build the future!
About The Role

We are looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist to lead our Marketplace efforts. We operate a robust marketplace connecting customers to relevant products and services across the world’s biggest e-commerce players, serving 1B transactions a year and growing 51% YoY. We’re constantly looking to develop this marketplace, especially as we expand into new verticals and markets, and we’re constantly innovating on the auction mechanics to ensure the best outcomes for our customers, advertisers, and partners. We’re looking for an entrepreneurial leader with the stats, econometrics, and modeling chops to own the health of this marketplace and lead our strategy for growing this.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for owning the health of our marketplace and driving its growth, including:
Defining the metrics for tracking the health of our marketplace, and build tracking to monitor this
Proactive analysis and modeling to identify opportunities to further develop the marketplace, including innovating and building cutting-edge auction mechanics / pricing
Partnering closely with R&D and Sales stakeholders to develop the strategy for growing the marketplace, including the product roadmap and Sales programs to drive growth
Conducting deep dives on marketplace impact to support high impact launches and Sales growth
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Math, or related fields.
Strong academic or professional experience with the latest auction theory
Entrepreneurial ownership and a deep desire to push the status quo
Strong and clear communication skills
Experience working with scaled marketplace and auction-driven businesses
Strong analytical / modeling experience tied to business outcomes
Good knowledge of Python 3 and SQL
Applied use of visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, tableau
Experience with common Python data science libraries such as pandas, numpy and scipy
Experience with relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL and/or SQL Server

Force for Good.

works both indoors and outdoors at plants, labs, and customer sites; and is responsible for assisting with daily lab packs within customer facilities, household hazardous waste (HHW) collections and lab moves.

Health and Safety is our #1 priority and we live it 3-6-5

Data Scientist/Product Owner blend The candidate in this position will be responsible for forecasting data + analytics, utilizing machine learning to predict the need of spare parts for the manufacturing of the F117 engine. Their work will support the understanding of which parts/how many parts need to be kept in inventory. About Actalent

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. WHY YOU'LL DIG YOUR GIG

In short, our purpose at TEAM is to blow people’s minds and steal their hearts with incredible brand experiences. We want you to help us help our brands do amazing, unprecedented, wildly creative things, creating moments that people never forget and that people will want to share with others. To make all that great work happen takes a lot of coordination and organization behind the scenes.
THE TEAM DIFFERENCE

People may forget your witty hashtag and your latest campaign tagline, but they will never forget how you made them feel. That’s because what a brand does is much more important that what is says. Actions speak louder than advertising and marketing. Experiences are what create real connections that lead to brand love and that’s what we do at TEAM. We’re a fun, collaborative, hard working group with a great office environment who takes care of our employees, to ensure that both in work and in life you experience something greater.
WHAT YOU'LL DO

TEAM seeks a Portfolio Brand Ambassador to serve as a dedicated brand expert and resource focused on all things brand related in the assigned market. The Brand Ambassador is expected to work under two important umbrellas; Marketing/Brand Ambassador & Commercial Sales. You will develop and maintain relationships with accounts, trade and distributor partners. Increase brand awareness and growth through menu placements, distribution and advocacy for the brand. An entrepreneurial mentality is key to success in this role.
Sale and Marketing
• Serve as brand category & mixology expert. Strengthen category leadership by obtaining menu placements in influential accounts.
• Align and with key local industry events and participate where the opportunity fits our strategy.
• Execute brand promotions, tastings and trainings as needed throughout your market within accounts, consumer/trade events and distributor partners.
• Stay informed of customer and consumer trends, share insights.
• Maintain calendar of activities and promotions and ensure effective communications with distributors and sales team.
• Provide bi-weekly market activity report to Regional Market Manger to include list of objectives, accomplishments, competitive activities, special projects and/or any needs.
Commercial Sales

• Call on key On and Off premise accounts, responsible for developing strong relationships, building brand awareness with the ultimate goal of increasing volume growth, menu placements and assisting Distributor partner in attaining our objectives.
• Utilize sales report to measure brand performance within your accounts, contribute to analysis and recommendations arising within territory.
• Ride with distributor sales representatives as needed.
• Participate in out-of-market sales blitzes.
• Work closer to maintain Top Volume accounts, reduce losses.
Financial Responsibility & Administrative Requirements
• Timely submission of weekly required program documents and deliverables.
• Manage assigned budget.
• Quarterly visit other markets as needed.
WAYS TO STAND OUT IN THE CROWD
• Passionate, self-motivated, creative, responsible
• Proactive communicator
• Comfortable speaking to small groups and being seen as an expert
• Great with people; from bartenders to distributors to consumers
• Event management or promotional background is a plus
• Previous experience in sales preferred
• Previous experience as a Brand Ambassador preferred
• Has sound financial skills and experience managing a budget
• Willingness to travel up to 30%
• Bartending, Sommelier, Mixology experience a plus
• Must be over 21 years of age
• Must reside in designated area.
WHO WE ARE

TEAM is a topnotch experiential marketing agency who develops and executes creative marketing campaigns rooted in strategy, insights and decades of learning. We partner with the best brands and people to deliver experiences that create inspiration at the point of engagement. Our roster of talent is essential to executing quality campaigns which live up to our high standards, for more information visit us on our website, Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter.

FDM’s Tech Returners Program with TD Bank
Have you had a career break of 12+ months?
Do you have previous software development experience?
Are you ready to re-join the workforce full time?
We have a great opportunity for you with US’ favorite bank!

Our strategic partner, TD Bank Group, has an exciting opportunity for those with a background in Software Development looking to Return to Work after a career break. Whether you have been on Child Care/Family Leave, Furloughed, or Unemployed recently, you will receive best-in-market software development training through the FDM Academy, before starting your new & exciting journey with TD Bank!
The role

This is an opportunity for returners to up-skill in current and emerging technologies, to re-familiarize themselves with current industry best practices and to enhance their technical knowledge on deployments with our clients.

The FDM Returners Program Team are here to support you through every stage of the journey, ensuring you have the confidence, skills and opportunity to step back into a successful and rewarding career in technology.

At the start of the program, you will receive 12 weeks of instructor-led and project-based training in object-oriented development within the Scrum framework. The training is carried out by our experienced FDM Academy trainers and will take place online before you start with TD Bank.
This is a full-time role, where you return to work as a senior or lead Software Developer.

Your employment with FDM will include the full-funded training and compensation for your time working at TD as part of their team as an FDM employee. After your 2 years with TD, you have the opportunity to transition permanently as a TD employee, subject to opportunity!
About You
Essential experience and criteria required:
Previous software engineering, development, and technology experience
Minimum 12+ month career break
Be able to work full time
Minimum of 3 years of total technology working experience
Be able to commit to working with FDM for two years once the training period is complete
Be able to work in either Ft. Lauderdale, FL or New York, NY, or Mt. Laurel, NJ
What we offer you:
A fully supported journey back to work with continuous development throughout your time with FDM
Up to 12 weeks of commercially relevant business and technical training (please note training is currently taking place online)
Fast-track career progression to get you back into business

Job Description Summary:

Meet the Team: At PayPal, our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400+ million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Your way to impact: The PayPal Post Purchase team is passionate about providing maximum value to both consumers and merchants from the moment after a monetary transaction happens and on. We’re on a journey to create rich, innovative experiences that people can’t imagine shopping without. We are looking for a Backend Engineer to work with us as we build this next generation of experiences.
Job Description:
Your day to day:
Contribute to backend and API development by converting ideas, designs, and requirements into concrete, stable production builds.
Take ownership of the successful implementation and delivery of new features and projects using tools like Java and Node.js.
Actively participate in system architecture discussions and technical design reviews to ensure the scalability, reliability, and security of the Post Purchase systems.
Enforce clean code and excellent coding practices by conducting thoughtful code reviews.
Actively participate in engineering team meetings to promote continuous growth and knowledge sharing.
Collaborate closely with Product Managers to meet and exceed customer needs in the simplest possible ways.
Collaborate with QA and other teams to resolve bugs.
Document and capture team knowledge in a way that is easily understandable and easy to find.
What you need to bring:
2+ years of experience developing, testing, and maintaining web backends and API’s.
The ability to efficiently ship clean, maintainable, and well tested code.
Familiarity with relational and non-relational database technology such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MongoDB.
Experience with a version control system.
Experience monitoring production systems and swiftly remedying any issues that occur.
A strong interest in joining a highly collaborative environment and working daily with Product Managers, UX Designers, and QA Engineers.
Bonus points if you have:
Implemented queue based systems and know when to reach for a polling or pub/sub solution.
Expertise in multiple server-side languages such as Java or Node.js
Interest in e-commerce, logistics, and/or sustainability
Solid knowledge of algorithms with good problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Interest in finance, e-commerce, or logistics.

We take all reasonable steps to seek out candidates with diverse experience and ensure our work environment is welcoming and respectful for everyone on our team.

Job description:

AVL has a great opportunity available to be a part of the fast-developing field of inverter and E-Motor for electric vehicles.  AVL is increasing our support in the Bay Area with an additional Application Engineer II specifically focused in electrification.

The Application Engineer II to commissions test systems and integrate subsystems to meet complex testing requirements with a focus on testing & application development for the E-Drive system.  In addition, this role will troubleshoot complex problems and develop solutions with appropriate input. The position will focus on AVL’s electrification market including but not limited to battery testing/emulation, inverter, eMotor and eAxle testing.

Qualified candidates must be able to take charge of projects once on-site and drive to completion while working with a Project Manager to manage cost and time estimates.  In addition, candidates must possess a minimum of 3 to 5 years of related experience including electrification/electronics and software experience.  The Application Engineer II position has direct communication with the customer and ownership of large complex test systems; excellent customer service and communication skills.
*Travel for the position will be approximately 40-60%
*Candidates should be located in the Bay, CA area
Applicants must have the unrestricted authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Employer will not sponsor an applicant for a work visa for this position.
Profile description:
Qualifications/Skills:
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or equivalent
* Master’s degree preferred.
* 3-5+ years related experience required.
* Experience in test automation equipment preferred.
* Understanding of instrumentation and electrical processes
* Experience related to testing methods and applications
* Able to read and understand electrical and mechanical schematics and drawings.
* Background in electrification (battery /eMotor / eAxle), testing or power electronics
* Strong software adaption and modification skills preferred
* Must possess excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Thorough knowledge of PC operations, structure, MS Windows, and computer networking required.
Responsibilities
Focus will be on supporting our Software Asset Management (SAM) practice by maintaining and onboarding Publishers, Software Products, Models, Entitlements and Allocations in ServiceNow
Assist with creating asset management procedure documentation.
Assist in maintaining and reporting on IT asset records throughout the asset life cycle.
Support SAM tools, processes, and procedures to automate the collection, storage, and reporting of key software data so that the products can be managed across the enterprise in an effective manner.
Assists SAM Manager with reconciliation and report generation.
Participate in special projects as needed to mitigate risks or realize opportunities.
Assist subject matter experts on software asset inventory operations and contributes advice to other stakeholders when needed.
Assists in operationalizing processes for managing unapproved software and hardware in the environment
Other SAM duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Experience
Comprehensive knowledge of IT Asset software lifecycle management and 1+ year of experience in IT Asset Management.
Required experience using IT software asset management solutions and tools, specifically ServiceNow.
Cloud Asset Management experience a plus
Methodical approach with high attention to detail.
Self-motivated and with a positive attitude.

La Compagnie des chemins de fer nationaux du Canada (CN) est à la recherche d'une personne très motivée pour combler un poste temps-plein (40h/semaine) de
Stagiaire Adoption de l’infonuagique au Canada, pour l'hiver 2023 (janvier à avril).
Résumé des fonctions

Le ou la stagiaire Adoption de l’infonuagique élabore des tableaux de bord analytiques, d’infrastructure et d’application pour des solutions faisant appel à différents outils, notamment Dynatrace et Power Bi. Le ou la titulaire du poste participe à la conception et au déploiement d’un site de socialisation au moyen d’Atlassian Confluence. De plus, la personne en poste pourrait être appelée à travailler à l’automatisation et aux essais de DevSecOps et à définir des « épiques » et des reportages dans Azure Boards. Le ou la titulaire du poste contribue à l’adoption de l’infonuagique, notamment auprès des architectes Systèmes d’entreprise et Solutions ainsi que des directeurs Conception de systèmes et Produits.
Principales responsabilités
Contribuer à la création de tableaux de bord

À propos du CN

En tant que chef de file dans les domaines du transport et de la logistique en Amérique du Nord, nous sommes un véritable pilier de l’économie. Forts d’une équipe d’environ 25 000 cheminots, nous avons pour priorité de faire progresser notre entreprise et l’économie. Nous transportons annuellement des marchandises d’une valeur de 200 G$ US pour un large éventail de secteurs, tels les ressources naturelles, les produits manufacturés et les biens de consommation, sur un réseau de 20 000 milles qui couvre le Canada et le centre des États-Unis. Le CN est la seule entreprise canadienne à figurer dans la catégorie du secteur du transport et de l’infrastructure du transport du Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World. Créé en 1999, l’indice DJSI World est l’indice de référence en ce qui a trait au développement durable. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.

Michigan State University operates FRIB as a user facility for the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Science (DOE-SC), supporting the mission of the DOE-SC Office of Nuclear Physics. As one of 28 DOE-SC user facilities, FRIB provides researchers with one of the most advanced tools of modern science to study rare isotopes, or short-lived nuclei not normally found on Earth. FRIB hosts what is designed to be the most powerful heavy-ion accelerator, enabling scientists to make discoveries about the properties of rare isotopes, nuclear astrophysics, fundamental interactions, and applications for society, including in medicine, homeland security, and industry.

The establishment of FRIB was funded by the DOE-SC, Michigan State University (MSU), and the State of Michigan, and user facility operation is supported by the DOE-SC Office of Nuclear Physics. Since 2010, MSU’s nuclear physics graduate program is ranked No. 1 in the nation, according to U.S. News and World Report’s rankings of graduate programs.
This position affords an exciting opportunity to become part of the world-class FRIB Laboratory that enables unique discovery opportunities in nuclear science.
Working/Functional Title
Desktop & Research Technology Professional
Position Summary
Purpose:

The Information Technology Professional will provide independent professional support of moderate complexity in the sphere of customer support, desktop computing systems administration, desktop software support, and hardware support.
Major Duties/Responsibilities:

-Provides independent general (first-level) diagnostic support to people at the laboratory for a broad range of technical areas, including IT associated with scientific computing, experimental devices, and machine controls. Resolves routine problems or questions and refers more complex issues to a more appropriate source.
-Duties include, but are not limited to:
Helpdesk triage
Create, modify and delete users, contacts, email accounts, distribution lists, and other related items
Troubleshoot server connectivity, AV/VC functions
Configuration and monitoring of servers and storage devices
Coordinate and execute upgrades to network software and hardware
-Coordinates laboratory computer, telephony, and printer deployments, updates, and upgrades
-Maintains the inventory of physical IT assets, including computer and telephony hardware, E911 Compliance15

-Trains and reviews the work of student staff members in areas related to their assigned projects develops new staff procedures in technical areas of expertise and provides related technical support to the team
-Manages laboratory software licenses and ensures compliance with all licensing requirements

-Independently works with people at the laboratory to analyze problems or needs, and develops solutions drawing on a high level of expertise in the position's assigned technical area to solve problems requiring novel uses of existing technology
-Performs other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the duties in this job classification
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Basic Knowledge of TCP /IP, DNS, DHCP
Basic Knowledge of Windows, MacOS
Intermediate Knowledge of customer relations and service skills
Ability to research, design, and implement new opportunities and technologies in areas of responsibility that add value to the laboratory
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver high-quality support to the team promptly
Excellent communication skills to communicate effectively and credibly, both verbally and in writing with all audiences
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suites
Unit-Specific Education/Experience/Skills

Knowledge normally acquired in the first two or three years of college, technical, vocational or business school such as an Associate's Degree in computer technology or information systems, with coursework in an information technology specialization related to the area of employment; one to three years of related and progressively more responsible or expansive work experience in an information technology area related to the duties to be performed OR a Bachelor's Degree in computer technology or information systems, with coursework in an information technology specialization related to the area of employment; up to six months of related and progressively more responsible or expansive work experience in an information technology area related to the duties to be performed; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
